00040 #ifndef _physactorrigid_h
00041 #define _physactorrigid_h
00042 
00043 //#include "vector3.h"
00044 //#include "quaternion.h"
00045 //#include "world.h"
00046 
00047 ///////////////////////////////////
00048 // Forward Declares
00049 
00050 class btRigidBody;
00051 #include "actorbase.h"
00052 
00053 ///////////////////////////////////
00054 // Actual code
00055 namespace phys
00056 {
00057     ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00058     /// @class ActorRigid
00059     /// @headerfile actorbase.h
00060     /// @brief This is the actor class for Rigid Objects.
00061     /// @details This class should be used to make any rigid object that can be moved as a
00062     /// result of force.  Most objects will fall into this catagory.  A few examples of a
00063     /// Rigid Object: Boxes, Car Frames, Chairs, etc.  For Semi Rigid bodies that are
00064     /// deformable, like jello, it is better to use ActorSoft.
00065     ///////////////////////////////////////
00066     class ActorRigid: public ActorBase {
00067         protected:
00068             /// @brief Used to simulate the behavior of a btRigidBody
00069             btRigidBody* physrigidbody;
00070 
00071             /// @brief Creates a rigid object for the actor.
00072             /// @details Creates a rigid object to be placed in the physics world later. @n
00073             /// This is automaticly called by the Constructor and shouldn't be called manually.
00074             /// @param pmass "Real Mass" The mass of the object.
00075             void CreateRigidObject (Real pmass);
00076 
00077             void PerformConvexDecomposition(unsigned int depth, float cpercent, float ppercent);
00078 
00079             void AddObjectToWorld (World *TargetWorld, btSoftRigidDynamicsWorld* btWorld);
00080 
00081             void RemoveObjectFromWorld(World* TargetWorld, btSoftRigidDynamicsWorld* btWorld);
00082 
00083         public:
00084             /// @brief Descriptive constructor.
00085             /// @details This constructor contains the basic information needed to make a Rigid Object. @n
00086             /// This class inherits from ActorBase.
00087             /// @param mass The mass the object will have in the World.
00088             /// @param name The name of the actor.
00089             /// @param file The 3d mesh file that contains the 3d model the actor will use.
00090             /// @param group The resource group where the 3d mesh and other related files can be found.
00091             /// @param _World Pointer to the World this object will be added to.
00092             ActorRigid(Real mass, String name, String file, String group, World* _World);
00093 
00094             /// @brief Destructor.
00095             /// @details The class destructor.
00096             virtual ~ActorRigid();
00097 
00098             /// @brief Creates a collision shape from mesh file.
00099             /// @details This function will read the location of every verticy in the mesh file and use that to
00100             /// construct a triangle mesh shape and attach it to this objects collision shape.  This shoiuld
00101             /// be used with only with Dynamic objects.
00102             /// @param accuracy A value from 1 to 4. The higher the more accurate, but the more resource intensive
00103             void CreateShapeFromMeshDynamic(short unsigned int accuracy=1);
00104 
00105             /// @brief Creates a sphere collision shape.
00106             /// @details Will dynamically create a sphere collision shape from the loaded mesh file.
00107             void CreateSphereShapeFromMesh();
00108 
00109             /// @brief Creates a collision shape from mesh file.
00110             /// @details This function will read the location of every verticy in the mesh file and use that to
00111             /// construct a triangle mesh shape and attach it to this objects collision shape.  This shoiuld
00112             /// be used with only with Dynamic objects.
00113             void CreateShapeFromMeshStatic();
00114 
00115             /// @brief Restricts movement on the axis or axies of your choice.
00116             /// @details This function will lock any and all axies you define you want to be locked.
00117             /// Simply pass true to allow movement on that axis, false if you don't.  This function
00118             /// is primarily useful for 2D games, in which if you are viewing the playing area from
00119             /// the side you can pass in LimitMovementOnAxis(true,true,false) and the object will
00120             /// only be able to move up, down, or side to side, but not in or out.
00121             /// @param x Allow or Disallow use of the X axis for movement.
00122             /// @param y Allow or Disallow use of the Y axis for movement.
00123             /// @param z Allow or Disallow use of the Z axis for movement.
00124             void LimitMovementOnAxis(bool x, bool y, bool z);
00125     };
00126 }
00127 #endif
